description:
Job Title : Sr. Analyst - II

 Location : Santa Monica Onsite role

Type : Contract 6 months

Looking for Local or someone who can relocate

Requisition Title: Sr. Analyst - II*

Description: Position Overview:

We are seeking a skilled Benchling ELN Engineer to join our team.

The ideal candidate will have experience in implementing and configuring Benchling's Electronic Lab Notebook (ELN) platform to support our research and development activities.

The candidate should have a strong background in software development and a deep understanding of scientific workflows in Translational Medicine and Discovery Research.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to understand business requirements and objectives for the ELN platform
  • Analyze current business processes and workflows to identify opportunities for improvement and automation through the use of ELN technology
  • Configure Benchling ELN to meet user and functional requirements
  • Develop custom workflows and integrations to enhance the functionality of the ELN platform
  • Develop dashboards and custom label reports leveraging Bartender
  • Perform development testing & troubleshooting
  • Draft technical documentation
  • Deliver technical build according to sprint sessions & assess work effort
  • Monitor system performance and troubleshoot any issues that arise, ensuring the smooth operation of the ELN platform

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
  • 3+ years of experience implementing and configuring Benchling ELN
  • Strong understanding of laboratory operations and scientific workflows
  • Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, JavaScript, or Java
  • Experience development dashboards & custom reports leveraging Bartender
  • Experience with Zebra printers & barcoding technologies
  • Experience working in a scientific research environment
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Ability to deliver on tight timelines
  • Solid understanding of development best practices including SDLC
  • Experience with computer system validation
